Titulo: Long-term oxidation and electrical behavior of Nb-doped Ti3SiC2 as solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: %, 2%, 5%, 7%, and 10%) as novel interconnect materials of intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cell (IT-SOFC) were studied in the simulated cathode atmosphere.
Titulo: Long-term oxidation and electrical behavior of Nb-doped Ti3SiC2 as solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: The long-term oxidation behaviors and area-specific resistance (ASR) of these compounds have been investigated at 800 degrees C up to 700hours.
Titulo: Long-term oxidation and electrical behavior of Nb-doped Ti3SiC2 as solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: Among these compounds, (Ti0.95Nb0.05)(3)SiC2 shows the best oxidation resistance and lowest postoxidation ASR (5.6mcm(2) after exposure at 800 degrees C in air for 700hours), endowing it a great promising material in the application as interconnect of IT-SOFC.
Titulo: Long-term oxidation and electrical behavior of Nb-doped Ti3SiC2 as solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: After oxidation, Nb is mainly doped uniformly into the lattice of rutile-TiO2 (r-TiO2) grains formed on the tested compounds.
Titulo: Long-term oxidation and electrical behavior of Nb-doped Ti3SiC2 as solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: Nb doping could decrease the concentrations of both oxygen vacancies and titanium interstitials in r-TiO2.
Titulo: Long-term oxidation and electrical behavior of Nb-doped Ti3SiC2 as solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: As a result, the oxidation rate of (Ti,Nb)(3)SiC2 decreases remarkably, the structure of the oxide scale changes from a duplex layer of TiO2 outer layer and TiO2+SiO2 mixture inner layer to a single mixture layer.
Titulo: Long-term oxidation and electrical behavior of Nb-doped Ti3SiC2 as solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: Nb doping also increases the amount of semifree electrons, causing the significant reduce of the postoxidation ASR of (Ti,Nb)(3)SiC2.
Titulo: Long-term oxidation and electrical behavior of Nb-doped Ti3SiC2 as solid oxide fuel cell interconnects
